DataElement.preferredName: Concomitant and Prior Medications Supplemental Qualifiers Dataset Indication Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator for the type of the reason that the concomitant and/or prior medications are used.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Concomitant and Prior Medications Supplemental Qualifiers Dataset Indication
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A dataset containing supplemental information, specifically non-standard variables, to parent records in the concomitant and prior medications domain.:A sign, signal, circumstance, or symptom which serves to indicate or point out the cause, pathology, treatment, or issue of an attack of disease; the basis for initiation of a treatment for a disease or of a diagnostic test (causal, or symptomatic, or disease-specific indication).

ObjectClass.preferredName: Concomitant and Prior Medications Supplemental Qualifiers Dataset
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A dataset containing supplemental information, specifically non-standard variables, to parent records in the concomitant and prior medications domain.

Concepts.longName: Concomitant and Prior Medications Supplemental Qualifiers Dataset
Concepts.definition: A dataset containing supplemental information, specifically non-standard variables, to parent records in the concomitant and prior medications domain.

Property.preferredDefinition: A sign, signal, circumstance, or symptom which serves to indicate or point out the cause, pathology, treatment, or issue of an attack of disease; the basis for initiation of a treatment for a disease or of a diagnostic test (causal, or symptomatic, or disease-specific indication).

Concepts.definition: A sign, signal, circumstance, or symptom which serves to indicate or point out the cause, pathology, treatment, or issue of an attack of disease; the basis for initiation of a treatment for a disease or of a diagnostic test (causal, or symptomatic, or disease-specific indication).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Concomitant Medication per CDISC CM Definition

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A sign, signal, circumstance, or symptom which serves to indicate or point out the cause, pathology, treatment, or issue of an attack of disease; the basis for initiation of a treatment for a disease or of a diagnostic test (causal, or symptomatic, or disease-specific indication)._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Having been present before a specific date or event._A state of being, such as a state of health.

Concepts.definition: Having been present before a specific date or event.
A state of being, such as a state of health.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Having no previous example or precedent or parallel; of a kind not seen before._Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

Concepts.definition: Having no previous example or precedent or parallel; of a kind not seen before.

Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Tests, examinations, evaluations used to determine a subject's status or response to intervention.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: Created initially to support CCR value domain for CTMS.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A sign, signal, circumstance, or symptom which serves to indicate or point out the cause, pathology, treatment, or issue of an attack of disease; the basis for initiation of a treatment for a disease or of a diagnostic test (causal, or symptomatic, or disease-specific indication).:Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: A sign, signal, circumstance, or symptom which serves to indicate or point out the cause, pathology, treatment, or issue of an attack of disease; the basis for initiation of a treatment for a disease or of a diagnostic test (causal, or symptomatic, or disease-specific indication).
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
